meanings.definition: An indefinitely long period of time.
meanings.sent1: It felt like an eon waiting for the school bell to ring.
meanings.sent2: The stars have been shining for eons in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: After what seemed like an eon, the slow turtle finally crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins stood for eons, silently witnessing the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: In the eon it took for the seed to sprout, the garden transformed into a lush paradise.

meanings.definition: A very large number or quantity.
meanings.sent1: There were eons of books stacked in the library.
meanings.sent2: She had eons of patience when dealing with children.
meanings.sent3: The bakery sold eons of cookies during the holiday season.
meanings.sent4: The scientist discovered eons of stars in the distant galaxy.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was filled with eons of gold coins, glittering in the sunlight.
